welcome welcome again welcome welcome my
name is Naomi Les and I
um I am so happy to be back after a
couple months hiatus um and I'm really
missing my pal Rabbi David uh who Rabbi
David Ingber who as many of us know um
suffered a pretty big injury and is
recuperating recovering and if you're
watching Rabbi David we just all like
raise our hands and wave to him right
now okay yes we love you and we miss you
desperately um and it's also his
birthday
yeah so we really are just sending him a
ton of love and um I'm so delighted to
be here with Glenn and with Elsa and
with Sid to bring in Shabbat
together so um welcome we are here uh at
the end of March uh tonight is a really
really special night um a it's Shabbat
and B it is a special Shabbat called
Shabbat shabbat is is the Shabbat before
the new month starts fun fact anybody
know what the next Hebrew month is
coming up nissan so that's everyone's
favorite right because in the middle of
Nissan is Fesa we can't wait for the
matzah but we also can't wait for
stories of
redemption and here we find ourselves in
the traveling of time and so our great
storytelling like literally our MMO for
being Jewish is coming up this month we
were strangers were kind to the stranger
we were oppressed and freed and redeemed
so we help those who are oppressed and
free them and redeem and help with their
redemption as well too we recall the
past we live in these cycles the moon
cycles and so that's kind of like where
we are we are in the cusp and I think I
live in Brooklyn and Brooklyn is about
to burst into bloom is it happening yet
here is any I haven't been in Central
Park yet
this they they literally just burst out
so I'm I'm so excited this is my
favorite time of year in the city you
know when you're all like why on earth
would I live in New York it's so hard
and then all you know you're going
through the winter and then the city
explodes into bloom and you're like that
first spring day right so here we are
we're we're like we're in that
anticipation and I think that that
optimism and looking forward and looking
ahead I'm going to just hint towards our
conversation later on tonight um with
our esteemed guests tonight looking to
the future and forecasting what what is
to come how can we turn challenge into
possibility and opportunity so we're
here to really celebrate possibility
tonight and story and community
and keep the main thing the main thing
shabbat shabbat we're here to really
welcome Shabbat and let go of the week
and so we'll do that through a few
different psalms and um I want to invite
you to turn to page
16 where we have a beautiful love
poem a gorgeous love poem that in the
middle of the page you'll see in the
bold is this beautiful uh beautiful line
taken out of Yadid Nephesh that talks
about revelation what will be revealed
what will be Higala now reveal please
bring revelation to me
and so I just want to invite you tonight
perhaps that is all you need tonight is
to allow
yourself to find some sort of revelation
it could be a smile from
someone it could be an exhale that you
didn't realize you've been clenching
your teeth for the last three days and
all of a sudden your jaw relaxes
whatever the revelation is for you maybe
there's a spiritual moment that you have
or a word that you connect to I want to
invite in the opportunity for
revelation and to spread over us a suka
of peace Sabbath peace
